conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows A, B, C, and D change in position and size when the light source moves backward above the objects.
When the light source moves backward, the shadows will move closer to the objects themselves.
The shadows will shift in the direction opposite to the light source's movement.
As the light source moves backward, the shadows will become smaller due to the angle at which the light hits the objects decreasing.
Shadow A moves closer to the object and becomes smaller.
Shadow B moves closer to the object and becomes smaller.
Shadow C moves closer to the object and becomes smaller.
Shadow D moves closer to the object and becomes smaller.
The final answer is that shadows A, B, C, and D will all move closer to their respective objects and decrease in size when the light source moves backward.
